foodDishes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
listOfSteps: Cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente.
In a separate pan, fry the pancetta or guanciale until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the pan with the pancetta/guanciale. Mix well.
Remove the pan from heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture.
The residual heat will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

foodDishes.name: Chicken Curry
ingredients: Salt and chili powder to taste
listOfSteps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until golden brown.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Stir in the curry powder, salt, and chili powder. Cook for a few minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Pour in the coconut milk, bring to a simmer, and cook until the chicken is tender.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Serve with steamed rice or naan bread.

foodDishes.name: Beef Lasagna
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
listOfSteps: In a pan, brown the ground beef with onions and garlic. Drain excess fat.
Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a baking dish, layer the lasagna: meat sauce, noodles, ricotta, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese.
Repeat the layers and finish with a layer of meat sauce and cheeses on top.
Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

foodDishes.name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
listOfSteps: Alternate slices of tomatoes and fresh mozzarella on a serving plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle balsamic glaze and olive oil over the salad.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.

foodDishes.name: Thai Green Curry
listOfSteps: In a pot, heat a splash of coconut milk and stir in the green curry paste until fragrant.
Add the sliced chicken and cook until it turns white.
Pour in the remaining coconut milk and bring it to a simmer.
Add the sliced bell peppers, zucchini, and bamboo shoots. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Season the curry with fish sauce and brown sugar. Adjust to your taste.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve with jasmine rice.

foodDishes.name: Pasta Aglio e Olio
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
listOfSteps: Cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente.
In a pan, heat the olive oil and add sliced garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until garlic turns golden.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan and toss well in the garlic-infused oil.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

foodDishes.name: Grilled Salmon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
listOfSteps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Coat the salmon fillets with the marinade and let them sit for 10 minutes.
Grill the salmon for about 4-5 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Serve with your favorite side dishes.

foodDishes.name: Beef Stir-Fry
listOfSteps: In a bowl, marinate the sliced beef with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce.
In a wok or large pan, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
Add the marinated beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until it browns. Remove from the pan.
In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed, and sauté the garlic, onion, bell pepper, and broccoli.
Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return the cooked beef to the pan and toss everything together.
Serve the beef stir-fry over steamed rice.

foodDishes.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
listOfSteps: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Grease and flour 4 ramekins.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter and bittersweet chocolate together.
Stir in the powdered sugar until well combined.
Add the whole eggs and egg yolks, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Stir in the vanilla extract, flour, and a pinch of salt until the batter is smooth.
Divide the batter among the prepared ramekins.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-14 minutes. The edges should be set, but the center will still be soft.
Remove the ramekins from the oven and let them cool for a minute before serving.
Invert each ramekin onto a serving plate and serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
